remark.p: member, National Security Council Survey Committee, 1948; Deputy Director of Central Intelligence, from October 7, 1950

member, National Security Council Survey Committee in 1948; Deputy Director of Central Intelligence from October 7, 1950 to 1951; Chairman, the President’s Committee on International Information Activities from January 20, 1953 to June 30, 1953; Special Assistant to the Secretary of State from September 1955 to January 1956; Special Assistant to the President from January to September 1956; Acting Special Assistant to the President from September 1956 to January 1957
Chairman of the President’s Committee on International Information Activities, 1953; former Deputy Director of Central Intelligence (1950–1951).
Chairman of President’s Committee on International Information Activities in 1953.
Special Assistant to the Secretary of State from September to November 1955
Special Assistant to the Secretary of State, September-November 1955; Special Assistant to the President, 1956–1957; member (representing the President), Operations Coordinating Board, 1956–1957

Special Assistant to the Secretary of State, September 1955–January 1956; Special Assistant to President Eisenhower, January–September 1956; Acting Special Assistant to President Eisenhower for National Security Affairs, September 1956–January 1957

Special Assistant to the Secretary of State, September 1955–January 1956; Special Assistant to President Eisenhower, January–September 1956; Acting Special Assistant to the President for National Security Affairs, September 1956–January 1957

Special Assistant to Secretary of State Dulles, September 1955-January 1956; Special Assistant to President Eisenhower, January-September 1956; Acting Special Assistant to the President for National Security Affairs, September 1956-January 1957
Special Assistant to Secretary of State Dulles, September–November 1955
